text: Duo is an album by pianist Cedar Walton and bassist David Williams which was recorded in Italy 1990 and originally released on the Italian Red label.Red Records album details accessed April 11, 2017 The album was first released as Off Minor due to a mistake incorrectly identifying the track "I Mean You" as another Thelonious Monk tune and as a result, the title and jacket were changed but the recorded contents remained the same.Discogs album entry, accessed April 11, 2017 == Reception == The review on Allmusic states "One of Cedar Walton's best recordings ... The communication between Walton and Williams is superb. ". == Track listing == All compositions by Cedar Walton except where noted # "I Mean You" (Thelonious Monk) – 5:24 Incorrectly identified as "Off Minor" on original release # "Pannonica" (Monk) – 5:43 # "Stablemates" (Benny Golson) – 6:21 # "Lament" (J. J. Johnson) – 9:46 # "N.P.S." – 6:13 # "My Old Flame" (Arthur Johnston, Sam Coslow) – 6:56 # "St. Thomas" (Sonny Rollins) – 5:42 # "Hagy" – 10:38 # "Blues for Alberto" – 6:40 # "I've Grown Accustomed to Your Face" (Frederick Loewe, Alan Jay Lerner) – 5:10 # "Ruby, My Dear" (Monk) – 7:51 == Personnel == *Cedar Walton – piano *David Williams – bass *Gaspare Pasini – alto saxophone (track 11) == References == Category:Cedar Walton albums Category:David "Happy" Williams albums Category:1991 albums Category:Red Records albums
title: Duo (Cedar Walton and David Williams album)
